title: Validate Setup Instructions and Documentation Accuracy
description: Test the updated README instructions by following them in a clean environment to ensure they are correct and complete.
details:
- Use a fresh clone of the repository or a clean environment.
- Follow the README's setup and development instructions step by step (install dependencies, run dev server, etc.).
- Note any missing, unclear, or incorrect steps and update the README as needed.
test_strategy: Successfully set up and run the project using only the README instructions. Confirm all commands and steps work as described.

title: Commit and Push Updated README.md
description: Commit the finalized README.md to the repository with a clear, descriptive commit message.
details:
- Stage the updated README.md file.
- Write a commit message such as 'docs: update README with comprehensive project documentation'.
- Push the commit to the remote repository (main branch or as per project workflow).
test_strategy: Verify the updated README.md appears correctly in the repository and that the commit history reflects the change.

title: Review Project and Gather Documentation Details
description: Analyze the project files, structure, and configuration to collect accurate and up-to-date information for the README update.
details:
- Examine package.json for dependencies and scripts.
- Review the directory structure, focusing on pages, components, data, lib, and configuration files.
- Identify any required environment variables (e.g., for Supabase) and note how to document them securely.
- Confirm the technology stack and architectural patterns used in the project.
- Take notes on any unique setup or usage instructions relevant to new developers.
test_strategy: Ensure all gathered information is accurate by cross-referencing with the actual project files and running scripts as needed.

title: Draft and Update README.md Content
description: Write and structure the updated README.md file to provide comprehensive project documentation for developers.
details:
- Add or update the following sections: Project Overview, Technology Stack, Getting Started (with prerequisites and setup steps), Project Structure, and Deployment Guidelines.
- Use clear Markdown formatting, code blocks for commands, and links to relevant documentation (e.g., Next.js, Tailwind CSS).
- Document environment variable requirements without exposing sensitive values.
- Include a table of contents if the README becomes lengthy.
test_strategy: Visually inspect the README for clarity, completeness, and formatting. Check for spelling/grammar errors and broken links.
